trans-unit.source: Sets the display based on a given format string

seg-source.mrk: Sets the display based on a given format string

target.mrk: Sets the display based on a given format string

trans-unit.source: String that defines the desired format. Setting this to blank will reset the control to the default format string for the current style. You can use the following format strings:

seg-source.mrk: String that defines the desired format.
Setting this to blank will reset the control to the default format string for the current style.
You can use the following format strings:

target.mrk: String that defines the desired format.
Setting this to blank will reset the control to the default format string for the current style.
You can use the following format strings:

trans-unit.source: "d" - The one or two digit day

seg-source.mrk: "d" - The one or two digit day

target.mrk: "d" - The one or two digit day

trans-unit.source: "dd" - The two digit day. Single digit day values are preceded by a zero

seg-source.mrk: Single digit day values are preceded by a zero

target.mrk: Single digit day values are preceded by a zero

trans-unit.source: "h" - The one or two digit hour in 12-hour format

seg-source.mrk: "h" - The one or two digit hour in 12-hour format

target.mrk: "h" - The one or two digit hour in 12-hour format

trans-unit.source: "hh" - The two digit hour in 12-hour format

seg-source.mrk: "hh" - The two digit hour in 12-hour format

target.mrk: "hh" - The two digit hour in 12-hour format

trans-unit.source: "H" - The one or two digit hour in 24-hour format

seg-source.mrk: "H" - The one or two digit hour in 24-hour format

target.mrk: "H" - The one or two digit hour in 24-hour format

trans-unit.source: "HH" - The two digit hour in 24 hour format

seg-source.mrk: "HH" - The two digit hour in 24 hour format

target.mrk: "HH" - The two digit hour in 24 hour format

trans-unit.source: "m" - The one or two digit minute

seg-source.mrk: "m" - The one or two digit minute

target.mrk: "m" - The one or two digit minute

trans-unit.source: "M" - The one or two digit month number

seg-source.mrk: "M" - The one or two digit month number

target.mrk: "M" - The one or two digit month number

trans-unit.source: "yy" - The last two digits of the year

seg-source.mrk: "yy" - The last two digits of the year

target.mrk: "yy" - The last two digits of the year

trans-unit.source: It is acceptable to include extra characters within the format string to produce a more rich display.

seg-source.mrk: It is acceptable to include extra characters within the format string to produce a more rich display.

target.mrk: It is acceptable to include extra characters within the format string to produce a more rich display.

trans-unit.source: However, any nonformat characters must be enclosed within single quotes.

seg-source.mrk: However, any nonformat characters must be enclosed within single quotes.

target.mrk: However, any nonformat characters must be enclosed within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: For example, the format string "'Today is:

seg-source.mrk: For example, the format string "'Today is:

target.mrk: For example, the format string "'Today is:

trans-unit.source: 'hh':'m':'s ddddMMMdd', 'yyy" would produce output like "Today is: 04:22:31 Tuesday Mar 23, 1996".

seg-source.mrk: 'hh':'m':'s ddddMMMdd', 'yyy" would produce output like "Today is:

target.mrk: 'hh':'m':'s ddddMMMdd', 'yyy" would produce output like "Today is:

trans-unit.source: Note: A DTP control tracks locale changes when it is using the default format string.

seg-source.mrk: A DTP control tracks locale changes when it is using the default format string.

target.mrk: A DTP control tracks locale changes when it is using the default format string.

trans-unit.source: If you set a custom format string, it will not be updated in response to locale changes.

seg-source.mrk: If you set a custom format string, it will not be updated in response to locale changes.

target.mrk: If you set a custom format string, it will not be updated in response to locale changes.

trans-unit.source: ddd MMM dd, yyyy hh:mm ttt

seg-source.mrk: ddd MMM dd, yyyy hh:mm ttt

target.mrk: ddd MMM dd, yyyy hh:mm ttt
